content.title: Intro
content.content:
1957
Preceded by
1957
1958
Year
1959
Followed by
1959

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1958.

content.title: January
content.content:
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to his grandson Michael George Tolkien.
29 - Actor Alister Duncan is born.

content.title: February
content.content:
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes to Wordsworth.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 205.

content.title: March
content.content:
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 205a.
28 - Actor Stephen Ure is born.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien is invited to attend a "Hobbit Dinner" in Rotterdam.

content.title: April
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Peter Alford.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 205b.
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien, signing as "Gandalf", sends a letter to a Dutchman.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letters 206 and 207.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 208.
12 - Tony Oliver, who would voice Merry in The Lord of the Rings: War of the Ring, is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 209.
5 - Author James Branch Cabell dies.
23 - Actor William Kircher is born.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien is driven at high speed to ABC Television's studio at Aston, Birmingham.

content.title: August
content.content: 29 - British actor Lenny Henry is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
14 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 211.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Misses E. Jones and J. Taylor.
20 - Viggo Mortensen, who would play Aragorn in The Lord of the Rings (film series), is born.
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 212a.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 213.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to L.M. Cutts.
28 - C. S. Lewis writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.

content.title: November
content.content:
2 - Taum Santoski, Tolkien linguist, is born.
10 - C. S. Lewis writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
30 - Actor Gareth Jones dies.

? - Actress Kathryn Hurlbutt is born.
? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes two letters to Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.
? - The Old English Apollonius of Tyre, containing a prefatory note by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
? - John D. Rateliff, editor and author, is born.
? - Edith Tolkien smashes her left arm in the garden, one of the reasons why that year became frustrating for the Tolkiens, preventing the completion of Letter 214 and further work on the Silmarillion.
? - In order to pay his taxes, Tolkien offers some of his manuscripts to Marquette University for the sum of £1250.[1]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Humphrey Carpenter, J.R.R. Tolkien: A Biography, “Cash or kudos”, p. 224
Years
1955 1956 1957 1958 1959 1960 1961
